lines.text: That's all freedom is... an illusion.

You're a scammer and you're a manipulator. You think that I don't know you? You are dead wrong. The only thing that has ever come out of your mouth is lies. Six years old... the paint... the paint all over your hands. All over our couch? 'I didn't do it.' 16 years old with the beer cans in my car. 'I didn't do it.' Let me hear you say it again, Alice. Come on! Let me hear you say it in here, huh? Come on, one for old times' sake!

[screaming]
I didn't do it!
1 first class ticket for 3 economy.
You'll never know what you ultimately sacrificed.
I need to talk to the guard who forgot to lock the gate.
[Alice is getting stoned]
You've got to be kidding.
What?
Do you really think getting stoned right now is a good idea?
Yes, I think it's an excellent idea.
I am an American citizen. I have a right to an attorney.
Oh, yes, and right to one telephone call, too.
Well, you were the one carrying the bag.
Yeah. The bag you packed.
Um, waiter, there's a bug in my snot.
If my brain wasn't on drugs right now, I could possibly kill someone.
Can I make a wish?
[first lines]
I scheduled the hearing for the Burmese.
[last lines]

I know a lot of people won't understand why I said I did it. But, for me, it was the right thing to do. Maybe more right than anything I've ever done before. And I know Darlene and Hank will never stop trying, til I'm out of here. Until I'm free.
